title: Completed PE Summary - Aspire/Mariscos
raw_html:
Vessel name Aspire
Category Fishing
Registered Owner & Manager: Mr P McMullan
Port of registry: Belfast
Flag: UK
Type: Fish Catching/Processing
Built: 1976
Construction: Wood
Length overall: 22.66
Gross tonnage: 138.00
Date & Time 18/12/02 11:42
Location of incident: Northern Irish coastal waters
Incident Type: Collision
Persons onboard: 4 crew
Injuries/ fatalities: None
Damage/ Pollution: None

Vessel name Mariscos
Category Fishing
Registered Owner & Manager: Mr I J Eccles
Port of registry: Portsmouth
Flag: UK
Type: Fish catching/processing
Built: 1986
Length overall: 9.88
Gross tonnage: 8.14
Date & Time 18/12/02 11:42
Location of incident: Northern Irish coastal waters
Incident Type: Collision
Persons onboard: 2 crew
Injuries/ fatalities: 2 injured crew
Damage/ Pollution: None

Synopsis

Collision between fv Aspire, which was returning to harbour, and fv Mariscos, a scallop dredger, which was stationary while working her catch.

Action taken:

The Chief Inspector of Marine Accidents has made recommendations to the owners of both vessels with reference to:

  • The need to maintain a vigilant lookout at all times when at sea

A recommendation was also made to the owner of aspire concerning:

  • The identification of measures to reduce the risk of collision caused by poor lookout from the wheelhouse

A further recommendation was also made to the owners of Mariscos with reference to:

  • The making of assumptions regarding the actions of other vessels
